mainText: React team have merged the Hooks proposal with some actionable items to consider. They announced that they might have some additional memory leak as part of this which goes beyond what just unexpected closure environments give us. For more information have a look at pull request number 68 on they GitHub repository.

After releasing the state of JS survey earlier this week, some people have criticized it from a couple of perspectives. The most important one is gender gap with 92.9% male, 6.9% female and only 0.9% non-binary, genderqueer or gender non-conforming. Also the question about Angular and AngularJS (older version of the Google's popular framework) have been merged resulting in some questionable charts for the last three years.

While online editing tools such as Grammarly and grammar suggestions from Google Docs arenâ€™t foolproof, the artificial intelligence and machine learning algorithms that power them are successfully improving the way many of us write. In the process, it saved millions of embarrassing errors caused by carelessness (there vs. they're) and, of course, caught mistakes that involved more challenging grammar rules.

You might have heard about Framer X and not know what it is. Framer X is the latest and greatest version of Framer Studio, the prototyping tool. Framer introduces the in-built use of React components to allow designers get closer to high-fidelity prototyping. The big difference Framer X makes is that designs can now be made more interactive. Interactions such as scrolling, clicking, moving and handling input are now possible, all thanks to React components.

A new version of Create React App, the popular CLI for React, has been released and it now supports some features which have been demanded from developers for a long time. The most exciting feature is the support of TypeScript. In addition to that it now supports SASS (the popular CSS pre-processor) without the need to eject. It also supports CSS Modules out of the box which by far is the most wanted feature on the list.
